intro: Phoradendron acinacifolium var. surinamense, commonly known as the Surinam holly, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Salicaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, red berries. It is often found growing on trees in humid, shaded environments, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various wildlife species. Its ornamental value has also led to its cultivation in some horticultural settings.
